Description: Fragment of a seal-impression made of fine brown Nile clay that was hardened after excavation and shows a darker discolouration. The rear shows two coils of basketry on one side and one coil of basketry on a second side, suggesting that the piece was attached between the wall and the lid of a basket. The upper side is flat with the side bent slightly downwards and shows two thirds of an impression of an oval scarab-like seal with finger impressions visible around the seal impression. Recognisable is a djed pillar in the middle with cobras on each side facing towards the pillar. The same motif is found on EA86924.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
